quote: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic. (Arthur C. Clarke)
Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower. (Steve Jobs)
Learning never exhausts the mind. (Leonardo da Vinci)
Engineering is the art of directing the great sources of power in nature for the use and convenience of man. (Thomas Tredgold)
The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before. (Bill Gates)
The best way to predict the future is to invent it. (Alan Kay)
The capacity to learn is a gift; the ability to learn is a skill; the willingness to learn is a choice. (Brian Herbert)
Scientists study the world as it is; engineers create the world that has never been. (Theodore von Kármán)
The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple. (Grady Booch)
Innovation is the ability to see change as an opportunity, not a threat. (Steve Jobs)
Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever. (Mahatma Gandhi)
Engineers like to solve problems. If there are no problems handily available, they will create their own problems. (Scott Adams)
Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute. (Harold Abelson)
The only way to discover the limits of the possible is to go beyond them into the impossible. (Arthur C. Clarke)
Anyone who stops learning is old, whether at twenty or eighty. Anyone who keeps learning stays young. (Henry Ford)
The engineer has been, and is, a maker of history. (James Kip Finch)
First, solve the problem. Then, write the code. (John Johnson)
Creativity is thinking up new things. Innovation is doing new things. (Theodore Levitt)
The beautiful thing about learning is that nobody can take it away from you. (B.B. King)
A good scientist is a person with original ideas. A good engineer is a person who makes a design that works with as few original ideas as possible. (Freeman Dyson)
The question of whether a computer can think is no more interesting than the question of whether a submarine can swim. (Edsger W. Dijkstra)
Innovation requires no special talent – it’s about being in the right place at the right time and seizing the opportunity. (Anonymous)
He who learns but does not think, is lost! He who thinks but does not learn is in great danger. (Confucius)

Engineering is not merely knowing and being knowledgeable; engineering is not merely analysis; engineering is not merely the possession of the capacity to get elegant solutions to non-existent engineering problems; engineering is practicing the art of the organized forcing of technological change. (Dean Gordon Brown)
Computer science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes. (Edsger W. Dijkstra)
Every once in a while, a new technology, an old problem, and a big idea turn into an innovation. (Dean Kamen)
Learning is not attained by chance; it must be sought for with ardor and attended to with diligence. (Abigail Adams)
As engineers, we were going to be in a position to change the world – not just study it. (Henry Petroski)
The most damaging phrase in the language is: 'It's always been done that way.' (Grace Hopper)
Innovation is the unrelenting drive to break the status quo and develop anew where few have dared to go. (Steven Jeffes)
The mind is not a vessel to be filled, but a fire to be kindled. (Plutarch)
At its heart, engineering is about using science to find creative, practical solutions. It is a noble profession. (Queen Elizabeth II)
To understand recursion, you must first understand recursion. (Unknown)
Without change there is no innovation, creativity, or incentive for improvement. (William Pollard)
The more I read, the more I acquire, the more certain I am that I know nothing. (Voltaire)
To be an engineer is to learn to stop worrying and love the wrench. (Unknown)
Talk is cheap. Show me the code. (Linus Torvalds)
The world is changing very fast. Big will not beat small anymore. It will be the fast beating the slow. (Rupert Murdoch)
In learning, you will teach, and in teaching, you will learn. (Phil Collins)
The fewer moving parts, the better. (Anonymous)
Innovation comes from the producer – not from the customer. (W. Edwards Deming)
An investment in knowledge pays the best interest. (Benjamin Franklin)
Engineers like to solve problems. If there are no problems handily available, they will create their own problems. (Scott Adams)
The illiterate of the 21st century will not be those who cannot read and write, but those who cannot learn, unlearn, and relearn. (Alvin Toffler)
The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing. (Henry Ford)
At its heart, engineering is about using science to find creative, practical solutions. It is a noble profession. (Queen Elizabeth II)
Innovation is the unrelenting drive to break the status quo and develop anew where few have dared to go. (Steven Jeffes)
Creativity is thinking up new things. Innovation is doing new things. (Theodore Levitt)
Learning is the beginning of wealth. Learning is the beginning of health. Learning is the beginning of spirituality. Searching and learning is where the miracle process all begins. (Jim Rohn)
We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit. (Aristotle)
